DOC.brief_summary: DebriS Interventional REmoval ACS ( DESIRE-ACS ) Study assess safety performance ECA Bell balloon subject undergo coronary percutaneous intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Study Protocol - Debris Interventional Removal ACS ( DESIRE-ACS )
DOC.detailed_description: Coronary arterial disease ( CAD ) define obstruction blood flow coronary artery ( i.e . artery supply blood heart muscle ) . Patients symptoms coronary artery disease usually suffer stable angina pectoris ( chest pain discomfort ) , unstable angina pectoris , myocardial infarction ( heart attack ) . The symptom range mild angina , moderate severe angina . In case CAD blood vessel chronically totally block ( total occlusion ) , stop blood flow block blood vessel . In case minimally invasive treatment surgery may need . `` Minimally invasive procedure '' consist angioplasty stent placement . The procedure perform local anesthetic patient lie back . Angioplasty routine , well know , non-surgical procedure perform make small incision skin groin catheter ( narrow tube ) guidewire ( thin metal wire ) insert reach block artery . After reach block artery crossing blockage guidewire , tiny balloon inflate inside artery open blockage . During course procedure small piece material cause blockage may break carried blood stream part body may lodge cause damage block blood flow . The Bell Balloon Catheter design help physician capture material may break .
DOC.criteria: Clinical criterion 1 . Subject ≥18 year age . 2 . Subject acute coronary syndrome ( STEMI NSTEMI ) . 3 . Candidate percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) native coronary artery . 4 . Anticipated patient life expectancy least 1 year since enrollment . 5 . Subject male nonpregnant female . 6 . Subject provide write informed consent . 7 . Subject able willing adhere require followup visit test . Angiographic Criteria 1 . Lesions amendable PCI . 2 . Angiographically thromboticappearing lesion amenable PCI . 3 . Lesion ( ) locate within native vessel ≥ 50 % < 100 % stenosis . 4 . The target lesion least 10mm proximal proximal edge stented lesion . 5 . Only single lesion treat investigational device . 6 . Vessel thrombolysis myocardial infarction ( TIMI ) grade 1 high flow use investigational device . 7 . Reference vessel diameter , Bell balloon place , 34mm diameter angiographic visual estimation . Clinical Criteria 1 . Women except whose menstrual period occur one year menopause sterilization surgery ( tubal ligation ) hysterectomy 2 . Known contraindication use heparin bivalirum ( Angiomax ) . 3 . Known contraindication use dual antiplatelet therapy 4 . Known hypersensitivity contrast medium adequately pretreated . 5 . Subject renal insufficiency , define baseline creatinine level ≥ 2.0 mg/dl . 6 . Subject known history neutropenia ( WBC < 3,000/mm3 ) significant anemia . 7 . Subjects know history coagulopathy thrombophilia [ prothrombin International Normalized Ratio ( INR ) > 1.5 , Platelet count < 80,000/ μL ] , resolve require treatment past 6 month . 8 . Major bleed within 6 month index procedure . 9 . A planned invasive surgical procedure within 30 day . 10 . Undergone cardiac surgery within past 30 day plan surgical procedure within 30 day study procedure 11 . Left ventricular ejection fraction < 25 % 12 . The patient cardiogenic shock hemodynamic unstable 13 . Cerebrovascular Accident ( CVA ) TIA within past 6 month . 14 . Exclusions preclude placement bell balloon per Instruction Use 15 . Subject capable understanding signing Informed Consent form . Angiographic Criteria 1 . Anatomical exclusion preclude placement bell balloon per Instruction Use . 2 . Target lesion inside within 10mm prior stent 3 . Target lesion distal prior place stent 4 . Severe calcification lesion site proximal . 5 . Aortoostial lesion 6 . Bifurcation lesion ( side branch diameter ≥ 2.0mm ) 7 . Severe coronary artery tortuosity ( Angulation > 450 ) 8 . Target lesion totally occlude , Thrombolysis Acute MI ( TIMI flow 0 ) despite predilatation small caliber balloon 9 . Coronary artery spasm absence significant stenosis
DOC.keyword: Acute Coronary Syndrome , Coronary Occlusion , catheter
